Integer.Name: FirstPacketTimeout
Integer.ToolTip: Maximum time to wait for the first packet of a block
Integer.Description: The maximum time (in milliseconds) the data receiver waits for the first packet of a block. This timer starts when the first packet of the stream is received. The value of zero implies that no first packet timeout will be enforced. Upon expiry of this timer, the buffer is returned with an operation result describing the error .

Integer.Name: InterPacketTimeout
Integer.ToolTip: Maximum time to wait in between two packets of a block
Integer.Description: The maximum time (in milliseconds) to wait in between two packets of a block. If set to 0, no maximum inter packet timeout is enforced. Upon expiry of this timer, the buffer is returned with an operation result describing the error.

Integer.Name: RequestTimeout
Integer.ToolTip: Maximum time to wait for all the packets of a block
Integer.Description: The maximum time (in milliseconds) that the data receiver waits for all the packets of a block. Upon expiry of this timer, the buffer is returned with an operation result describing the error. This timer starts when the first packet of the stream is received.

Integer.Name: PreemptiveResendTimeout
Integer.ToolTip: The time (in milliseconds) the data receiver waits before making a preemptive resend request on the last block.
Integer.Description: The time (in milliseconds) that the data receiver waits to receive a packet from the most recent block before making a resend request when no activity is detected. If set to 0, a pre-emptive resend will not occur.

Integer.Name: MaximumPendingResends
Integer.ToolTip: Maximum number of missing packets that are allowed at one time per block
Integer.Description: Maximum number of packets in a block that can be missing, at any one time, before the buffer is returned with an operation result describing the error. A value of zero indicates that there is no limit to the number of pending resend requests.

Boolean.Name: RequestMissingPackets
Boolean.ToolTip: If enabled, missing packets are requested
Boolean.Description: If enabled, missing packets are requested. Other parameters that control the resend request behaviour include MaximumResendRequestRetryByPacket, MaximumResendGroupSize, ResendRequestTimeout, MaximumPendingResends and ResendDelay.

Integer.Name: LatencyLevel
Integer.ToolTip: Allows the tuning of the data receiver to modify the acceptable amount of latency
Integer.Description: Only available when receiving data through the eBUS Universal Pro driver for windows. This value allows the tuning of the driver to modify the acceptable amount of latency at the cost of using greater CPU resources. A value of 0 minimizes latency as much as possible.

Integer.Name: AutoResetOnLackOfResources
Integer.ToolTip: Threshold of free buffers in the data receiver
Integer.Description: The threshold of buffers available to be filled in the data receiver. When the number of buffers available to be filled is less than this threshold, all incomplete buffers are returned with an operation result describing the error.
Integer.DisplayName: Auto Reset On Lack Of Resources

Integer.Name: MaximumResendRequestRetryByPacket
Integer.ToolTip: Maximum number of times a resend request can be issued for a given packet
Integer.Description: The maximum number of times a resend request can be issued before the buffer is returned with an operation result describing the error. A value of zero indicates that there is no limit on the number of resend requests.
Integer.DisplayName: Maximum Resend Request Retry By Packet

Integer.Name: MaximumResendGroupSize
Integer.ToolTip: Maximum size of a resend group
Integer.Description: GigE Vision allows for a single resend request to contain requests for 1 or more packets. This parameter defines the maximum number of packets that can be requested at one time. A value of zero indicates that there is no limit to the resend group size. If the number of consecutive missing packets is larger than this value, the operation result is set to TOO_MANY_CONSECUTIVE_RESENDS.

Integer.Name: ResendRequestTimeout
Integer.ToolTip: Time to wait before re-issuing a resend request
Integer.Description: The amount of time (in microseconds) the data receiver waits for a response to a resend request before issuing the request again.

Integer.Name: ResendDelay
Integer.ToolTip: Time (in microseconds) to wait before issuing a resend request for a missing packet
Integer.Description: Time (in microseconds) to wait before issuing a resend request for a missing packet.

Integer.Name: ResetOnIdle
Integer.ToolTip: Time (in milliseconds) that the data receiver waits for while there is no GVSP packet coming before resetting itself.
Integer.Description: This parameter defines the time that the data receiver waits for while there is no GVSP packet coming before resetting itself. On a reset, 1) All the Receiving block buffers to Ready for Processing states with error code AUTO_ABORTED. All Empty block buffers are still in the data receiver and ready for receiving. 2) The data receiver goes back to the pre stream start status. This parameter allows the data receiver to better handle the cases where the data receiver receives no packets for a long time due to a connection loss or a large number of packets are dropped on the network. Without this parameter, the data receiver may not be able to recover quickly as it may try to request many packets resends. This parameter also can help the data receiver work properly in the situation that the application is only a data receiver and the transmitter resets the block_id. For example, the transmitter transmitted the block_id n and data receiver received it. Then data receiver is excepting block_id n+1 but if the transmitter resets the block_id to 1. Without this parameter to reset it back to the pre stream start status the data receiver will ignore the new coming in blocks until it receives block_id n+1. For some transmitter devices, acquisition stop and start resets the block_id to 1. For a software transmitter, for instance Pleora Video server, after you call PvTransmitterGEV::Close() and then PvTransmitterGEV::Open() then the block_id resets to 1. In both cases if the stream destination IP address and port remain same as before then the data receiver application still receives those blocks. Data receiver could not tell if those block data are from new coming block data or the packet resend for the same block_id which has been received before.

Boolean.Name: ForceMissingPacketsAtNextBlockStart
Boolean.ToolTip: Stop waiting for packets from a block if packets begin to arrive from the following block
Boolean.Description: Forces the data receiver to stop waiting for packets from a block in the event that packets begin to arrive from the next block.
Boolean.DisplayName: Force Missing Packets At Next Block Start

Boolean.Name: EnableMissingPacketsList
Boolean.ToolTip: Keep track of packets that were lost while attempting to receive a block.
Boolean.Description: Enables the data receiver to keep track of packets that were lost while attempting to receive a block. Enable if you plan on using PvBuffer::GetMissingPacketIdsCount and PvBuffer::GetMissingPacketIds .

Integer.Name: MaximumPreQueuedBuffers
Integer.ToolTip: Number of buffers queued into the driver in one call between user space and kernel space
Integer.Description: Only available when receiving data through the eBUS Universal Pro driver. Number of buffers queued before passing the buffers between user space and kernel space. Increasing this number reduces the number of times data is exchanged between the SDK in user space and the driver in kernel space. This can increase performance in the case where data is being streamed at high frame rates. Before using this parameter, ensure that a sufficient number of buffers queued into the stream.

Boolean.Name: OnlyStartOnFirstPacket
Boolean.ToolTip: When set to true, the data receiver is waiting to receive the first packet ( id = 0 ) of the next block to start.
Boolean.Description: When set to true, GVSP packets are discarded until a GVSP leader of a block is received. When it is set to false, SDK starts processing the first received GVSP packet regardless of its packet id, at which point the SDK requests that the device resend the lost packets. Setting this feature to false can cause multiple unwanted resend requests on multicast system.

Enumeration.Name: ExtraBlockCompletion
Enumeration.ToolTip: Add extra condition for block completion
Enumeration.Description: Add extra condition for block completion

EnumEntry.Name: OnNextBlockStart
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Forces the data receiver to stop waiting for packets from a block in the event that packets begin to arrive for a next block.
EnumEntry.Description: Forces the data receiver to stop waiting for packets from a block in the event that packets begin to arrive for a next block.

EnumEntry.Name: OnBlockTrailer
EnumEntry.ToolTip: Forces the data receiver to stop waiting for packets from a block in the event that the trailer packet is received or packets begin to arrive for a next block or it receive.
EnumEntry.Description: Forces the data receiver to stop waiting for packets from a block in the event that the trailer packet is received or packets begin to arrive for a next block or it receive.

Integer.Name: DataPort
Integer.ToolTip: UDP port to which the GigE Vision transmitter should send data
Integer.Description: UDP port to which the GigE Vision transmitter should send data. For unicast data, this is the local (PC side) port number. For multicast data, this is the port number to which the receiver is subscribed.

Integer.Name: MulticastIPAddress
Integer.ToolTip: Address of the multicast group, if applicable.
Integer.Description: Address of the multicast group, if applicable.

Integer.Name: LocalIPAddress
Integer.ToolTip: Local IP address used to receive data
Integer.Description: Local IP address used to receive data from the GigE Vision transmitter.

Integer.Name: DeviceIPAddress
Integer.ToolTip: IP address of the GigE Vision transmitter from which the stream is receiving data
Integer.Description: IP address of the GigE Vision transmitter from which the stream is receiving data.

Integer.Name: Channel
Integer.ToolTip: The GigE Vision streaming channel from which data is received.
Integer.Description: The GigE Vision streaming channel from which data is received.

Integer.Name: BitsCount
Integer.ToolTip: Number of data payload bits received by the stream.
Integer.Description: Number of data payload bits received by the stream.

Integer.Name: BytesCount
Integer.ToolTip: Number of data payload bytes received by the stream.
Integer.Description: Number of data payload bytes received by the stream.

Integer.Name: BlockCount
Integer.ToolTip: Number of blocks received from the device.
Integer.Description: Number of blocks received from the device.

Integer.Name: SamplingTime
Integer.ToolTip: The time elapsed (in ms) between the first block received and the latest block received.
Integer.Description: The time elapsed (in ms) between the first block received and the latest block received. Note the definition of the first block in this case would be the first block received after having either opening the stream or issuing the Reset command.

Float.Name: AcquisitionRateAverage
Float.ToolTip: Average acquisition rate since the first block was received.
Float.Description: Average acquisition rate since the first block was received.

Float.Name: Bandwidth
Float.Description: Instant throughput in bits per second. Note that this value is calculated based on a finite sequence of received blocks within a finite period of time.

Float.Name: BandwidthAverage
Float.ToolTip: Average throughput since the last reset in bps.
Float.Description: Average throughput since the last reset in bits per second.

Boolean.Name: TimeoutCountedAsError
Boolean.ToolTip: When enabled, timeouts are considered errors.
Boolean.Description: When enabled, timeouts are considered errors. Depending on the nature and behavior of an application, timeouts can be normal occurrences or represent real errors.

Boolean.Name: AbortCountedAsError
Boolean.ToolTip: When enabled, aborted buffers are considered errors.
Boolean.Description: When enabled, aborted buffers are considered errors. Depending on the nature and behavior of an application, aborted buffers can be normal occurrences or represent real errors.

Integer.Name: ErrorCount
Integer.ToolTip: Count of RetrieveBuffer operation result errors
Integer.Description: Count of RetrieveBuffer operation result errors since the last reset.

Enumeration.Name: TimestampSourceEffective
Enumeration.ToolTip: Source of the buffer timestamps in use.
Enumeration.Description: Source of the buffer timestamps in use. Hardware refers to the device timestamp present in the GVSP header. Software refers to host-side timestamps recorded when a buffer is delivered by the data receiver.

Enumeration.Name: TimestampSourcePreferred
Enumeration.ToolTip: Preferred source of the buffer timestamps used to track statistics.
Enumeration.Description: Preferred source of the buffer timestamps used to track statistics. Hardware refers to the device timestamp present in the GVSP header. Software refers to host-side timestamps recorded when a buffer is delivered by the data receiver.

Integer.Name: BlockIDsMissing
Integer.ToolTip: Discontinuities in block IDs
Integer.Description: The number of missing block IDs. Calculated using the block ID of incoming blocks to count blocks sent by the GigE Vision device that were not successfully delivered. This is typically caused by the application not being able to de-queue and re-queue buffers quickly enough.

Integer.Name: PipelineBlocksDropped
Integer.ToolTip: Count of blocks dropped by the PvPipeline.
Integer.Description: Count of blocks dropped by the PvPipeline. The oldest blocks are dropped from the PvPipeline output queue if it runs out of resources.

Integer.Name: PacketsRecovered
Integer.ToolTip: The number of lost packets successfully recovered by packet resend requests. Duplicate received packets are not counted.
Integer.Description: The number of lost packets successfully recovered by packet resend requests. Duplicate received packets are not counted.

Integer.Name: PacketsRecoveredSingleResend
Integer.ToolTip: The number of lost packets successfully recovered by packet resend requests without any resend request retries.
Integer.Description: The number of lost packets successfully recovered by packet resend requests without any resend request retries.

Integer.Name: UnexpectedResend
Integer.ToolTip: Unexpected resent packet count.
Integer.Description: Unexpected resent packet count. This includes packets received multiple times for a buffer and packets received before a buffer has been completed.

Integer.Name: ResendGroupRequested
Integer.ToolTip: The number of resend requests issued by the data receiver
Integer.Description: The number of resend requests issued by the data receiver

Integer.Name: ResendPacketRequested
Integer.ToolTip: The number of packets the data receiver requests with ResendGroupRequested.
Integer.Description: The number of packets the data receiver requests with ResendGroupRequested.

Integer.Name: LostPacket
Integer.ToolTip: Lost packet count.
Integer.Description: Lost packet count. This counter tracks the number of expected packets that were not received. This counter does not include the packet count of missing blocks.

Integer.Name: IgnoredPacket
Integer.ToolTip: The number of packets received that are not related to the current set of blocks being processed.
Integer.Description: The number of packets received that are not related to the current set of blocks being processed. This includes packets with block ids that have already been processed.

Integer.Name: RedundantPacket
Integer.ToolTip: Number of packets received more than once
Integer.Description: Number of packets received more than once

Integer.Name: PacketOutOfOrder
Integer.ToolTip: Number of packets received out of order
Integer.Description: Number of packets received out of order

Integer.Name: DataOverrun
Integer.ToolTip: Data overrun count on the device.
Integer.Description: Count of data overrun notifications received from the device. A data overrun notification is sent when the incoming (from a sensor) data rate exceeds the device's data capture rate.

Integer.Name: PartialLineMissing
Integer.ToolTip: Partial line missing count on the device.
Integer.Description: Count of images that have at least one partial line missing. Only available for devices using a Pleora IP engine.

Integer.Name: FullLineMissing
Integer.ToolTip: Full line missing count on the device.
Integer.Description: Count of images that have at least on full line missing. Only available for devices using a Pleora IP engine.

Integer.Name: BlocksDropped
Integer.ToolTip: Dropped block count on the device.
Integer.Description: Count of dropped block notifications received from the device. Dropped block notifications are sent when the frame buffer is full and the incoming data cannot be processed. Only available for devices using a Pleora IP engine.

Integer.Name: EOFByLineCount
Integer.ToolTip: Count of frames where the previous frame was NOT the last one of a sequence of sub frames.
Integer.Description: Count of frames where the previous frame was NOT the last one of a sequence of sub frames but the line count was met. Only available for devices using a Pleora IP engine.

Integer.Name: InterlacedEven
Integer.ToolTip: Count of interlaced even fields from an interlaced image.
Integer.Description: Count of interlaced even fields from an interlaced image. Only for devices using a Pleora IP engine.

Integer.Name: InterlacedOdd
Integer.ToolTip: Count of interlaced odd fields from an interlaced image.
Integer.Description: Count of interlaced odd fields from an interlaced image. Only for devices using a Pleora IP engine.

Integer.Name: LocalProblem
Integer.ToolTip: Count of "Local Problem" status notifications received from the device
Integer.Description: Count of "Local Problem" status notifications received from the device. An internal problem in the device implementation occurred while processing the request. Optionally the device provides a mechanism for looking up a detailed description of the problem. (Log files, Event log, 'Get last error' mechanics). This error is intended to report problems from underlying services (operating system, 3rd party library) in the device to the client side without translating every possible error code into a GigE Vision equivalent.

Integer.Name: Unknown
Integer.ToolTip: Count of status notifications received from the device not mapping to a known value
Integer.Description: Count of status notifications received from the device not mapping to a known value.

Integer.Name: PacketUnavailable
Integer.ToolTip: Count of "Packet Unavailable" status notifications received from the device
Integer.Description: Count of "Packet Unavailable" status notifications received from the device. The device returns this status notification when a packet is requested but is no longer available.

Integer.Name: ResultImageError
Integer.ToolTip: Count of failed buffers with operation result set to IMAGE_ERROR.
Integer.Description: Count of failed buffers with operation result set to IMAGE_ERROR. Incremented when a corrupt image arrives due to discontinuities in data between the camera and the hardware responsible for transmitting packets in the GigE Vision device. This can include data overrun, partial and full lines missing.

Integer.Name: ResultMissingPackets
Integer.ToolTip: Count of failed buffers with operation result set to MISSING_PACKETS.
Integer.Description: Count of failed buffers with operation result set to MISSING_PACKETS. Happens when at least one packet of the buffer is missing when it was released back to the calling application.

Integer.Name: ResultBufferTooSmall
Integer.ToolTip: Count of failed buffers with operation result set to BUFFER_TOO_SMALL.
Integer.Description: Count of failed buffers with operation result set to BUFFER_TOO_SMALL. Happens when a buffer queued for streaming was not large enough to contain the received payload.

Integer.Name: ResultTimeout
Integer.ToolTip: Count of failed buffers with operation result set to TIMEOUT.
Integer.Description: Count of failed buffers with operation result set to TIMEOUT. This happens when FirstPacketTimeout has elapsed without receiving any packets or when RequestTimeout has elapsed after receiving the first packet for the buffer.

Integer.Name: ResultAborted
Integer.ToolTip: Count of failed buffers with operation result set to ABORTED.
Integer.Description: Count of failed buffers with operation result set to ABORTED. After calling AbortQueuedBuffers all buffers in the stream are completed with the ABORTED operation result.

Integer.Name: ResultAutoAborted
Integer.ToolTip: Count of failed buffers with operation result set to AUTO_ABORTED.
Integer.Description: Count of failed buffers with operation result set to AUTO_ABORTED. The data receiver may enter a state where packets arrive for a newer block while one or more packets for an older block are still missing. The AutoResetOnLackOfResources parameter is the threshold of free buffers maintained by the data receiver. If a packet arrives for a new block and only AutoResetOnLackOfResources buffers are currently available then all incomplete buffers that have not yet finished being filled are immediately returned with result code AUTO_ABORTED.

Integer.Name: ResultStateError
Integer.ToolTip: Count of failed buffers with operation result set to STATE_ERROR.
Integer.Description: Count of failed buffers with operation result set to STATE_ERROR. The data receiver experienced an internal error while attempting to receive this buffer.

Integer.Name: ResultInvalidDataFormat
Integer.ToolTip: Count of failed buffers with operation result set to INVALID_DATA_FORMAT.
Integer.Description: Count of failed buffers with operation result set to INVALID_DATA_FORMAT. Poorly formatted data was received from the GigE Vision transmitter.

Integer.Name: ResultTooManyResends
Integer.ToolTip: Count of failed buffers with operation result set to TOO_MANY_RESENDS.
Integer.Description: Count of failed buffers with operation result set to TOO_MANY_RESENDS. The data receiver stops attempting to receive a block if too many packet resends were issued.

Integer.Name: ResultTooManyConsecutiveResends
Integer.ToolTip: Count of failed buffers with operation result set to TOO_MANY_CONSECUTIVE_RESENDS.
Integer.Description: Count of failed buffers with operation result set to TOO_MANY_CONSECUTIVE_RESENDS. The data receiver stops attempting to receive a block if a set of consecutive lost packets exceeds MaximumResendGroupSize.

Integer.Name: ResultResendsFailure
Integer.ToolTip: Count of failed buffers with operation result set to RESENDS_FAILURE.
Integer.Description: Count of failed buffers with operation result set to RESENDS_FAILURE. The data receiver has attempted to recover missing packets by issuing resend requests. The maximum number of retries has been reached without having received the requested packet. The MaximumResendRequestRetryByPacket property can be used to configure how many times the data receiver re-attempts a request for a lost packet.

Integer.Name: ResultNotInitialized
Integer.ToolTip: Count of failed buffers with operation result set to RESENDS_FAILURE.
Integer.Description: Count of buffers with an operational state that is not initialized. This operational result is used when ForceMissingPacketsAtNextBlockStart is enabled. The buffer used by the current block is skipped because of a missing block and the operational result of the buffer is set to not initialized. This means nothing in the buffer is valid.

Integer.Name: BlockCountHigh
Integer.ToolTip: ToolTip
Integer.Description: Description

Integer.Name: BlockCountLow
Integer.ToolTip: ToolTip
Integer.Description: Description

Integer.Name: BlockIDsMissingHigh
Integer.ToolTip: ToolTip
Integer.Description: Description

Integer.Name: BlockIDsMissingLow
Integer.ToolTip: ToolTip
Integer.Description: Description

Integer.Name: BytesCountLow
Integer.ToolTip: ToolTip
Integer.Description: Description

Integer.Name: BytesCountHigh
Integer.ToolTip: ToolTip
Integer.Description: Description

Integer.Name: DataReceiverType
Integer.ToolTip: Enumeration of the DR type
Integer.Description: This allows us to turn on and off features in the xml

Integer.Name: MaxQueuedBuffer
Integer.ToolTip: Max Buffers in the system
Integer.Description: Max Buffers in the system

Integer.Name: OperatingSystem
Integer.ToolTip: ToolTip
Integer.Description: Description

Port.Name: Device
Port.ToolTip: Port giving access to the device.
